intro:
Select a dataset to explore for this intro.

Selection required for tour.

Select number of discovered surrogate variables to account for in differential expression analysis and plots.

Used to adjust for unknown sources of variation e.g. batch effects.

Click to show inputs for cell-type deconvolution with dtangle.

Used to estimate the relative proportion of cell types in a bulk samples by using a single-cell dataset.

Note: requires a single-cell dataset.
MDS plot of all samples adjusted for library size and log transformed with rlog from DESeq2 for RNA-seq data.

MDS plot of all samples adjusted for library size and log transformed with rlog from DESeq2 for RNA-seq data.

If specified, surrogate variables and the Pair metadata column are regressed out for visualizations and modeled for differential expression analysis.

Select a test group then a control group to download differential expression and pathway analysis results.

Differential expression analysis is performed with limma and models surrogate variables and the Pair metadata column if specified.

KEGG and GO gene-set tests are run with cameraPR.
Select genes to plot adjusted expression for each sample within each Group name.

Click to download and fill in metadata for samples.

Fill in the Group name column to define comparison groups.

Fill in the Pair column to account for a random effect e.g. individual or cell-line (optional).

You can also add other columns that describe samples.

Click to upload filled-in metadata for samples.

This will take a minute or so to re-run rlog transformation and surrogate variable analysis.

Hint: Maintain multiple metadata files locally to switch between alternative sample groupings.
